The Indian technical textile association (itta) is the only Association of the technical textile industry in India covering all 13 Segments, including composites. The office of the textile Commissioner, mot, goi facilitated the formation of itta in january 2010. The objective of itta is to promote, support, develop and Increase the production, consumption, and export of technical Textiles to make India a powerhouse of technical textiles in the days To come. Itta has members from both the domestic and international, including members from eu & japan and representing the entire technical textile value chain From raw material to finished goods producers, machinery Manufacturers, consultants, centers of excellence and R&d/academic institutions. Under nttm-approved r&d projects, Number of itta members have become partners to various coes and Research institutes. Itta regularly organizes national & international level conferences & exhibitions, symposiums & workshops. Recently successfully organised three national conclaves on protective textiles, sports textiles and agro textiles supported by nttm, mot and also regularly organizing the executive development program (edp) on key segments of technical textiles for the skilled manpower development for the industry. Already organised six days program on protective textiles, medical textiles, geosynthetics and industrial textiles. In future itta is planning more courses on major verticals/ segments of technical textiles, e.G., Buildtech, agrotech, mobiltech, sportech, nonwovens, coating & functional finishes, etc.

We breathe new life into plastic waste, transforming it from pollutant to a valuable resource. As a responsible waste processor, we are deeply committed to environmental protection, employing advanced machinery and skilled manpower to optimize waste transformation while minimizing our ecological footprint. Research and development are the cornerstones of our operations, ensuring we remain at the forefront of technological advancements. We are steadfast in our dedication to creating a circular economy, a crucial step towards conserving our environment for future generations. With eight production facilities spread across India, approaching a boasting a processing capacity of 3, 00,000 t/ per year and over 3,000 direct and indirect employees, we are steadily progressing towards becoming a waste-neutral group of industries. We ensure 100% process waste recycling, and all our units adhere to controlled emissions, demonstrating our unwavering commitment to environmental stewardship. Our robust waste collection network, unwavering compliance with respect corporate governance and with extended producer responsibility (epr), and unwavering focus on traceability, zero liquid discharge (zld), and waste-to-wealth conversion through sustainable closed-loop solutions make us an ideal partner for consumers and brand owners alike. Trisvaraa came into being in march 2018. The label Offers some of the finest heritage Indian hand-woven Textiles and beautifully designed hand-embroidered Ensembles. The products are quintessentially Indian in form and Spirit; they are traditional and timeless with a con- Temporary appeal. The idea behind trisvaraa was to Present to the world a different interpretation of our Heritage weaves and intricate and delicate Hand-embroideries of our master weavers and arti- Sans respectively. In aparajita’s words: “trisvaraa cel- Ebrates Indian craftsmanship in its truest form”. As is the story of any new creative beginning there Were many challenges along her journey. Aparajita States that she found a sense of freedom in this com- Petitive and challenging world of luxury fashion. She Says, “i have always been a creative person but i Worked in the corporate sector for many years. How- Ever when career fatigue set in and the boardrooms Did not hold any appeal, i shifted to the world of Design and fashion without any prior experience in This sector. There was always the fear of failing with The added fear of financial losses. It has been an Uphill task to establish my label and bring it to its cur- Rent form. The only thing i started out with was an Innate love for fabrics, textiles, designs and colours And an eye for detail”. Trisvaraa’s focus has always been to use hand-woven Textiles and employ age-old skills of different kinds of Hand-embroidery techniques. In these times of fast Fashion, through her label, she promotes the idea of Sustainable and slow fashion and advises people to Buy less and choose well and to do away with the idea Of wearing a hand-crafted garment only once. Ac- Cording to her, if you choose well, you will surely want to Wear an outfit more than once. The label continuously Strives to maintain the highest standards in quality and Purity with every new collection. A trisvaraa ensemble is A promise of trust and faith. We always try to deliver More than we promise. Trisvaraa is also an endeavour to rekindle our love for Exquisite heritage hand-embroidery which is unfortu- Nately but surely on the decline. Fashion trends influ- Ence the choices of the younger population; however, As they get older, they gravitate towards timeless and Traditional silhouettes. Trends will always be there; but They will always be fleeting, momentary and temporary. On the other hand, the grace and charm of a tradition- Ally hand-crafted garment will always have its own Timeless appeal. However, it is a challenge to keep the Cost of production low when designing a unique com- Pletely hand-embroidered ensemble. Aparajita states: “my designs define me. Establishing My own clothing line has definitely not been an easy Task in today’s world. It requires a lot of hard work and Perseverance and patience. Creating a market space For my creations has not happened in a day. My journey Has just started, and i plan to go a long way. To con- Stantly create new designs is challenging and i would Not have it any other way. I love my work passionately And i thank god for giving me an opportunity to do Something i love doing”. Trisvaraa is for the woman of today who is beautiful, Bold, smart, intelligent and who wants to look her best Every single day of her life. The label is no doubt young And new, but our work is rooted in the ancient art of tra- Ditional handloom weaving and exquisite hand-em- Broidery. The journey so far has been very enriching And gratifying in terms of creative fulfilment. Aparajita Adds: “my designs give me the freedom to express Myself in a way not found anywhere else and i am look- Ing forward to the rest of this journey”.
826, 1st Floor, 9th Cross, 10th Main, Indiranagar 2nd Stage, Bengaluru 560038 Karnataka India

Uniforms unlimited is a pioneer in the uniforms industry. Recognizing the importance of well-turned out staff, uniforms unlimited has been making finely-cut and well-stitched uniforms for over 25 years. Over the years, exceptional customer service, innovative styles, unmatched comfort and durability have become our trademarks. We have achieved recognition and appreciation from one and all. Continuous research, innovation and up-gradation is a part of the process. Hence we not only manufacture but design, develop, create and innovate too. Immaculate styling, meticulous cuts, perfect fits and precise stitching make us the best couturiers for the hospitality industry. Taking perfect care of the various job demands of different departments, our uniforms provide a balanced combination of good looks and comfort. Our made-to-measure department can customize any uniform as per individual requirements. Through intense research, we came up with innovative fabrics and techniques, like the use of heat resistant fabrics that absorb sweat, ventilation techniques etc that became the first designs for “chefs unlimited”. Today every designer and craftsman in the field follows our mandate. With focus on quality and consistency, we design, develop and create work wear for chefs, who take pride in their profession. Our chef-wear, is finely designed and cleverly crafted to suit the needs of any type of industrial kitchens. Customized chef wear designed and made for easy movement and comfort in kitchens, make us today the most sought after brands in the culinary world. We create the best styles according to the latest trends. While doing so they are balanced with practicality. Branded / mill made fabrics, buttons, threads, lining etc. Of the top most quality from reputed manufacturers are used for more durable uniforms. We ensure continuous innovation for improved products, be it in raw materials, fabrics or technology. It’s a matter of pride for most of the top chefs to get their chef coats tailor-made from us. Zubin is one such expert designer who believes ‘a stylish yet practical uniform enhances value and unifies the complete experience of hospitality’. He is a designer with a holistic approach blending richness in cultures and offers finely styled uniforms, which are practical as well as elaborate enough to bring instant connectivity with the destination where the hotels are located. Dezenzia emphasizes on the textures of fabrics used, the princess lines on the uniform, the subtle detail of the embroidery and pleats that turn a uniform into a couture garment. Dezenzia is uniforms limited’s designer collection studio. An optimum combination of creativity and sensibility it balances high-fashion with practicality. It’s the haute couture collection for businesses where impressions count. The power of customized designer uniforms in company’s branding cannot be under estimated. "Dezenzia” design studio boasts of a team of highly skilled and artistic “nift ians” who meticulously create the finest uniform designs that enhance the image of our clients to the highest of international standards. Dezenzia imbibes the value of a region/culture into design by repackaging the couture into finely styled garments that enhance the image of the client to the highest standards. Our endeavor has always been focused on amalgamating top style with highly practical attire. This is a huge challenge for fashion designers per say, but mr. Zubin having the thorough knowledge of uniforms and a state-of-art-facility to back his experience, can bring about this fusion with ease.

Vhitz fashions pvt. Ltd. Was established in the year 1950 as foundry unit in ambala city haryana India in the name and style krishna foundry works pvt. Ltd. Where we earned a name in foundry not for the quality but also for quantity and fare dealing. A step ahead now we have entered into the field of garment manufacturing by the name of vhitz fashions pvt. Ltd Products Our products are : Women’s wear Men’s wear Girl’s wear Baby wear Home furnishing throws cushion covers All the products are being manufactured acrylic Cotton woolen Blended yarns As may be required by customers and availability in the market Manufacturing The required yarn is purchased and tested, or supplied by the customer Yarn is knitted into a small piece called swatch is measured. Measured swatch is then washed and measured to observe shrinkage . Based on the observed shrinkage the final product is knitted, cutting, stitching washed and pressed and packed is ready for approval. After approval production is undertaken. During production the products is checked tested at every stage of manufacturing e.I.: 1. yarn purchase 2. knit swatch 3. washing of swatch 4. knitting fabricks 5. washing fabricks 6. stiching as per the requirement 7. linking 8. sewing 9. overlock 10.Kaaj button 11. Final inspection and packing List of machinery Computerized stoll flat bed knitting machines having knit width 72” and 96’’ in fine gauge and coarse gauge. stoll okc 420 3.5.2 4 stoll tc 340 6.2 2 stoll okc 502 3.5.2 3 stoll okc 420 7.2 2 Complete washing and pressing equipment required for the finishing of the products produced, Other machine include:- Number of machines Installed Linking machine 18 Sewing machine 30 Over lock machine 04 Folding 02 Kaaj and button 01 set Rewinding machine 2 Inspection table 20 Boiler 300 kgs Table press 05 Hand press 02 Complete washing equipment 2 set Finished products obtained after finishing is checked for quality before packing and dispatch Our team 1. aseem gupta: is an engineering graduate. Kkp group of companies is a pioneering innovative sustainable textile manufacturer, striving to deliver excellence and value optimizing technology. Our state-of-the-art vertically integrated manufacturing model is the strength that uniquely allows us to consistently outperform our peers, and provide the best-in-class range of products using the most non-destructive practices thereby ensuring the preservation of our planet earth. Above all, we proudly identify ourselves with an illustrious legacy of over four decades of unrelenting commitment to ‘business ethics’ as our most fundamental guiding principle. Today, kkp is fast accelerating to achieving the milestone of 1,000 crores of turn over per annum. In doing this, it has created direct and indirect employment opportunities for over 13,000 people, including a predominant number of women, resulting in tremendous social upliftment amongst the local communities. Under the able direction of its second-generation leadership, kkp continues its legacy of promoting community development through investments into the social areas of education, skilling, sports and health. Moreover, kkp has also got the agenda of a sustainable future and earth conservation at the forefront of its business and operations.
